description: The walk follows the London Loop footpath through Trent Park and along the Salmons Brook valley through the historical area of Enfield Chase, a former royal hunting forest.

events.name: Walk led by Enfield Council Officer
events.notes: Visitors can arrive at any time during the opening hours.There may be queues at busy times.

factsheet.heading: History
paragraphs: Enfield Chase is a former royal hunting forest first recorded in the middle ages.  Over the centuries the forest was gradually cut-down and fragmented.  Though some small areas of ancient woodland have been retained they are now mostly surrounded by farmland with minimal public access.

factsheet.heading: Landscape Restoration
paragraphs: Enfield Council is implementing landscape restoration measures including woodland creation and wetland features with improved public access.  50,000 trees were planted in the winter of 2020/21 and a further 50,000 will be planted this winter.  Public access improvements include the construction of a new 3.3km footpath along the London Loop linking Trent Park to Rectory Farm on The Ridgeway.

location.address: Entrance on east side of Cockfosters Road, Enfield, EN4 0DZ

name: Enfield Chase Walk
